title: OpenAI in Share Sale Talks; Trump to Announce Chip, Pharma Tariffs Soon
description: US equity futures post modest gains as investors prepare for a rush of earnings. OpenAI is said to be in early talks about a potential sale of stock at a valuation of $500 billion. President Trump says tariffs on chips and pharmaceutical imports will come in the "next week or so." Sharon Bell of Goldman Sachs believes the US economy is growing below potential and will also do so in the second half. Neil Dutta of Renaissance Macro thinks President Trump's eventual Fed appointee will have some convincing to do of their new colleagues. “Bloomberg Brief” delivers the market news, data and analysis you need to set your agenda. (Source: Bloomberg)

The company's return to China is still uncertain as it seeks Exports Licensing Licenses to China. President Trump is expected to announce Tariffs on Chip, Pharma Tariffs soon. Meanwhile, AMD, the world’s second-largest chip manufacturer, fell over 5% in premarket, with the stock trading down 5%. The article also discusses a 10-year auction for OpenAI.
